Method Detail

parse

public static TilePattern[] parse(TileTokenString tiletokenstring,
                                  int[] locked,
                                  int[] lockedsets)
parses a TileTokenString for all possible valid combinations of singles, connected pairs, pairs, chows, pungs and kongs.

Parameters:
tiletokenstring - representation of an n tile hand, using the tilenumbers from TilePattern
locked - int[] array representing the face-up tiles
lockedsets - int[] array representing which sets are face-up
Returns:
TilePatter[] representing all possible valid combination patterns

parseConcealed

public static TilePattern[] parseConcealed(TilePattern pattern,
                                           TileTokenString tiletokenstring)
Thie method is the access point to generating all possible patterns based on "face down" in-hand tiles.

Parameters:
pattern - an empty pattern, used as expansion basis
tiletokenstring - a TileTokenString representation of the tiles in hand
Returns:
the set of all possible TilePatterns for the tiles defined by tiletokenstring

parseLocked

public static TilePattern parseLocked(TilePattern lockedpattern,
                                      int[] locked,
                                      int[] lockedsets)
This method handles running through the "locked" list of tiles and adding the proper sets to the initial pattern before the FSA runs over the variable content.

Parameters:
lockedpattern - an empty TilePattern
locked - int[] array with all "face up" tiles
lockedsets - int[] array with how these tiles are arranged
Returns:
TilePattern the tile pattern representing the "face up" tiles

tilepattern

private static TilePattern[] tilepattern(TilePattern pattern,
                                         int token,
                                         int patterntype)
This method handles the terminal clause, when no more tokens exist to pass through the FSA

Parameters:
pattern - the final pattern to return
token - the final token to add to the pattern
patterntype - the final patterntype
Returns:
the finalised TilePattern

single

private static TilePattern[] single(TilePattern pattern,
                                    int token,
                                    TileTokenString tokenstring)
processing of single tiles: - look at token - look at next token - if next = token+1, send on to connected pair processing node - if next = token check if there is a downstream pair possible and send on for processing; also send on for pair processing - if neither, signal "single", update the recording pattern, and call self with next as token.

Parameters:
pattern - The TilePattern seen so far
token - an interger representation of an MJ tile, according to the list in TilePattern
tokenstring - a TileTokenString representation of a hand
Returns:
the set of TilePatterns that can be reached from here

connected

private static TilePattern[] connected(TilePattern pattern,
                                       int token,
                                       TileTokenString tokenstring)
processing of connected pairs: - look at token - look at next token - if next = token+1, send on to chow processing node - if next = token, check if there is a downstream chow possible and send on for processing - if neither, signal "connected pair", update the recording pattern, and call "single" with next as token.

Parameters:
pattern - The TilePattern seen so far
token - an interger representation of an MJ tile, according to the list in TilePattern
tokenstring - a TileTokenString representation of a hand
Returns:
the set of TilePatterns that can be reached from here

pair

private static TilePattern[] pair(TilePattern pattern,
                                  int token,
                                  TileTokenString tokenstring)
processing of pairs: - look at token - look at next token - if next = token, send on to pung processing - if not, signal "pair", update the recording pattern, and call "single" with next as token.

Parameters:
pattern - The TilePattern seen so far
token - an interger representation of an MJ tile, according to the list in TilePattern
tokenstring - a TileTokenString representation of a hand
Returns:
the set of TilePatterns that can be reached from here
